mixed-citation.article-title: Middle Permian ostracods (Crustacea) from the Guadalupe Mountains, West Texas, USA

tp:treatment-sec.p:
USA • 1 complete carapace ; Guadalupe Mountains , West Texas , ‘ McKittrick Canyon’ Member , Bell Canyon Formation , MKCS1 section, sample 4 (GM5); Capitanian , Middle Permian ; MNHN.F.F63374
.

This specimen shows a clear oval kirkbyan pit in the middle part of the valve. The right valve has PB and AB with a different radius of curvature, whereas they are quite equivalent in Kirkbyidae . Herein, the PB has a very small radius of curvature and AB a large one. The ornamentation is coarse.
Sample 4 (GM5), MKCS1 section, ‘McKittrick Canyon’ Member, Bell Canyon Formation, Guadalupe Mountains, West Texas , USA , Capitanian, Middle Permian (this work).
